Breakfast recipe: Masala Upma/ Khichdi Servings: 2 Duration : 20 mins In any one's home Easy and quick breakfast recipe is Upma, people who like Upma is very less but most of the people like Upma if it cooked with spices, Veggies which makes your Upma tasty & delicious ðŸ˜‹ Upma is a kind of thick porridge which is smooth & easy to swallow especially for kids. It's from south India which is prepared with semolina/ broken wheat/ Sooji / rava and also contains onion, tomato, green chillies etc., I made a tasty Upma that is masala khichdi which is a special dish in occasions or you can make when you got bore of eating normal Upma Nutrition facts: Mint : Vitamins: A & C Minerals: Iron Carrot: Vitamins : A, C & B6 Minerals : calcium, iron, magnesium & potassium Potato: Vitamins: C & B6 Minerals : calcium, iron, magnesium & potassium Green Peas: Vitamins: C & B6 Minerals : calcium, iron, magnesium & potassium Onion: Vitamins: C & B6 Minerals: Iron, magnesium & potassium Today I prepared a simple and tasty dish for breakfast which is made out of semolina, spices and veggies Let's start with ingredients and follows Procedure Ingredients: Semolina - 1 cup - 235 gms Water - 3 cups Green chillies - sliced - 2 Clove - 1 piece Cinnamon - 1 small piece Ginger-garlic paste - 1 tsp Onion - chopped - 1 cup Carrots, beans, potato Â - chopped - 1 cup Coriander leaves - 1/4 cup peas - 1/2 cup Mint leaves - 8 Salt - 1 1/2 tsp Ghee - 1/4 cup Turmeric powder - 1/2 tsp For Tempering: Mustard seeds/ Avvalu - 1/4 tea spoon Cumin seeds/ Jeera - 1/2 tea spoon Urad dal/ Minapappu - 1/4 tea spoon Bengal gram/ Senagapappu - 1/4 tea spoon Curry leaves - 4 to 5 Procedure:
  • Heat skillet pan Add ghee over medium heat
  • Add tempering, cashew nuts, green chillies Saute them
  • Take out cashew nuts in a cup
  • Add onion, curry leaves & mint
  • Saute 1 min
  • Add chopped carrot & potato , ginger-garlic paste
  • Saute 2 mins
  • Add chopped beans & peas
  • Saute 2 mins
  • Add semolina & Saute 5 mins
  • Add salt & mix well
  • Add water & cook till it becomes non sticky & soft
  • Add coriander & mix well
  • Take out in a serving bowl & garnish with fried cashew nuts
  • Masala Upma / Khichdi is ready
  • Serve it hot with fresh coconut chutney/Â Coriander Coconut Chutney / Kothimeera Kobbari Chutney
